caption:
Congratulations to our #MyChampionMoment winner, Jennifer Kelly and her family!

Their story:
My Champion Moment- June 2012: I finally graduated with my Masters in Geology: I was 4 months pregnant, had been diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis the year before, and had worked for an ECHL hockey team for 4 years to put myself through school. I watched the Stanley Cup Final- the Kings won, and I texted my husband the great news- except he was deployed with the Army and did not appreciate being woken up :slightly_smiling_face: Fast forward 4 years (bottom photo)... I have a hockey-obsessed daughter who worships Kopitar and is a Lil King this year- it's really in her blood! GO KINGS GO!
caption_raw:
Congratulations to our #MyChampionMoment winner, Jennifer Kelly and her family!

Their story:
My Champion Moment- June 2012: I finally graduated with my Masters in Geology: I was 4 months pregnant, had been diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis the year before, and had worked for an ECHL hockey team for 4 years to put myself through school. I watched the Stanley Cup Final- the Kings won, and I texted my husband the great news- except he was deployed with the Army and did not appreciate being woken up :slightly_smiling_face: Fast forward 4 years (bottom photo)... I have a hockey-obsessed daughter who worships Kopitar and is a Lil King this year- it's really in her blood! GO KINGS GO!

caption:
Los Angeles Kings Hall of Fame Television Play-by-Play Broadcaster Bob Miller will take a medical leave of absence.

Miller is slated to undergo heart bypass surgery. The date of the surgery has not yet been determined. The timeline for Miller s return to the TV booth also is undetermined.

 It is unfortunate that I have to miss Kings telecasts but I have to get this taken care of as soon as possible,  said Miller.  I know the telecasts will be in good hands and I hope to return to the TV booth as soon as my health allows.
caption_raw:
Los Angeles Kings Hall of Fame Television Play-by-Play Broadcaster Bob Miller will take a medical leave of absence.

Miller is slated to undergo heart bypass surgery. The date of the surgery has not yet been determined. The timeline for Miller’s return to the TV booth also is undetermined.

“It is unfortunate that I have to miss Kings telecasts but I have to get this taken care of as soon as possible,” said Miller. “I know the telecasts will be in good hands and I hope to return to the TV booth as soon as my health allows.”

caption:
Remember to download the @Fanpics app to see your candid photos from the best moments of every Kings home game! Starting in November and every month this season, share your best photos to @Fanpics for a chance to enter the Fan of the Month contest. November s winner will receive two tickets to a Kings home game! So how does it work? - Share your best Fanpics photos to @Fanpics via Instagram, Facebook, or Twitter by the last day of the month
- The four finalists will be announced on the 1st and voting is open for three days
- Cast your votes in the comments section of the finalists post on any Fanpics social media account
- Winner will be announced on the 4th
